alert.note: Alert for Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 4:15AM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches mainly above 8500 feet. Higher amounts possible on favored terrain. Winds gusting over 70 mph near and above treeline can be expected by early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Southwest San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...Light snow will be possible through the day with minimal impacts. Winds and snow will increase through the evening ahead of an approaching cold front with the highest gusts and near whiteout conditions expected after midnight. * IMPACTS....Travel will be very difficult if not impossible due to blowing and drifting snow reducing visibility to near zero at times. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
